Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by suggesting that Chinese soldiers were "taking control" of Hong Kong in July 2019, when in fact there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Chinese soldiers were taking control of Hong Kong. The provided video is from 2018 and there is no official announcement or press statement from the Hong Kong government regarding a military takeover.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video of Chinese soldiers driving military trucks in Hong Kong indicates a takeover, without considering alternative explanations or context. The video could have been taken out of context or may have a different purpose.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is from 2018 and has been circulating online since then. It falsely presents the video as evidence of a recent event in July 2019.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
